title: Doctors stunned to find 27 contact lenses in woman's eye; here's how it happened - The Times of India
summary:
Doctors Stunned to Find 27 Contact Lenses in Woman's Eye

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A recent medical case has revealed a shocking discovery of 27 contact lenses lodged in a woman's eye, leaving doctors astonished. This incident raises significant awareness about the importance of proper eye care and hygiene.

  • The woman had been experiencing discomfort in her eye for several weeks.
  • Upon examination, doctors found multiple lenses that had accumulated over time.
  • This case highlights the risks associated with wearing contact lenses beyond their intended use.
"It's essential to adhere to lens-wearing guidelines to avoid such complications." - Eye Specialist

This remarkable case emphasizes the critical need for awareness and education surrounding contact lens usage.
newTitle: Doctors Stunned to Find 27 Contact Lenses in Woman's Eye

title: Annual malaria cases at 2 mn in 2023, down 97% since 1947: Health ministry - Business Standard
summary:
Annual malaria cases at 2 mn in 2023, down 97% since 1947: Health ministry

Published on: October 2023 Source: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

India has made significant strides towards eradicating malaria, reducing annual cases to 2 million in 2023 from 7.5 crore in 1947, according to the latest report from the Health Ministry.

  • Cases have fallen from 11,69,261 in 2015 to 2,27,564 in 2023, and deaths reduced from 384 to just 83.
  • 24 states and UTs are categorized as having a low malaria burden (Category 1) by 2023.
  • India exited from WHO's High Burden to High Impact group in 2024.
  • Projects like Integrated Vector Management have successfully disrupted the transmission cycle.
  • Community engagement and healthcare integration have strengthened malaria prevention efforts.
  • India aims to eliminate malaria by 2030 with a significant focus on targeted interventions.
"India’s commitment to capacity building and research has also been a cornerstone of its success." - Ministry of Health

The substantial decrease in malaria cases over the decades showcases India's successful public health interventions and the determination to achieve a malaria-free status by 2030.
newTitle: India Achieves Milestone in Malaria Reduction with 97% Decrease Since 1947

title: Dinga Dinga Virus Raises Global Health Concerns in Uganda - Oneindia
summary:
Dinga Dinga Virus Raises Global Health Concerns in Uganda

Updated: Wednesday, December 25, 2024, 21:31 [IST]

A new virus, identified as 'Dinga Dinga,' has emerged in Uganda, raising alarms similar to those experienced during the coronavirus pandemic. Preliminary reports indicate it is particularly affecting women and teenage girls, with approximately 300 cases reported in the Bandibugyo district.

  • The United Nations warns of a potential epidemic linked to the Dinga Dinga virus.
  • Symptoms include fever and uncontrollable shivering, with behavior reported to resemble dancing in affected individuals.
  • There is an ongoing investigation into the transmission modes and the development of a cure.
  • The outbreak in Uganda coincides with a viral outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo, further complicating health challenges in the region.
“The importance of international cooperation and preparedness in the face of such unpredictable health crises cannot be overstated.”

Health authorities are urging people to seek medical attention if they exhibit symptoms and are emphasizing the infectious nature of this new virus.
newTitle: Dinga Dinga Virus Raises Global Health Concerns in Uganda

title: Three Red Flag Signs of Diabetes You May Spot During Christmas Celebration; Easy Ways to Slash the Risk - Times Now
summary:
Three Red Flag Signs of Diabetes You May Spot During Christmas Celebration; Easy Ways to Slash the Risk

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article discusses the risks of diabetes during the busy holiday season and highlights key symptoms to look for, along with tips for prevention.

  • Around 537 million people globally are living with diabetes.
  • Christmas indulgence can cause blood sugar levels to rise.
  • Three typical symptoms of diabetes are polydipsia (excessive thirst), polyuria (increased urination), and blurred vision.
  • Preventive measures include maintaining a low-carb diet, exercising regularly, and staying hydrated.
“Over the Christmas period there are lots of events during which people will overindulge.” - Dr. Adam Staten

Overall, it’s crucial to monitor health especially during festive seasons when lifestyle changes can lead to health risks.
newTitle: Recognizing Diabetes Symptoms During Christmas: Key Signs and Prevention Tips

India poised to be malaria-free by 2030: Health ministry - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

India has made significant progress in reducing malaria cases over the past 75 years, with a goal to become malaria-free by 2030, according to the Union health ministry.

  • The number of malaria cases has decreased from 75 million at independence to 2 million in 2023.
  • Annual malaria deaths have dropped from 800,000 to 83.
  • 122 districts reported no new malaria cases.
  • India exited the WHO's High Burden to High Impact group in 2024.
  • From 2015 to 2023, new malaria cases fell by 80%.
  • 24 states and UTs are in category 1, reporting less than 1 case per 1,000 population.
“India’s journey toward a malaria-free future is a story of remarkable transformation and progress.” - Union Health Ministry

In conclusion, the health ministry emphasizes that India's proactive public health strategies have been crucial in combating malaria, paving the way for potential elimination by 2030.
newTitle: India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

title: Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning' - TheHealthSite
summary:
Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning'

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: The Health Site

Mpox continues to be a global concern with Belgium reporting its first case of the Clade 1b strain, marking it as the eighth non-African country to do so. The WHO has noted the rapid spread linked to sexual contact.

  • Belgium reports first case of Clade 1b strain of mpox.
  • The strain is spreading faster through sexual contact, not animal to human transmission.
  • Other detected countries include Canada, Germany, Sweden, Thailand, the UK, and the US.
  • Initially emerged in the DRC, now spreading among young adults and potentially children.
“It is spreading among young adults via close physical contact, often sexual contact,” WHO stated.

While mpox can be transmitted from animals, recent outbreaks suggest human-to-human contact is a major factor in its spread, particularly through sexual activities.
newTitle: Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning'

Essential steps to combat antibiotic resistance - The Indian Express
summary:
Essential Steps to Combat Antibiotic Resistance

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Indian Express

This article presents critical steps for individuals to take in order to combat the growing issue of antibiotic resistance. It emphasizes responsible antibiotic use and preventive measures to reduce infection rates.

  • Only take antibiotics when prescribed by a healthcare professional and complete the full course of treatment.
  • Antibiotics are ineffective against viruses; avoid using them for viral infections such as the common cold or flu.
  • Good hygiene practices can help prevent infections, thereby reducing the need for antibiotics.
  • Stay up-to-date with vaccinations to prevent infections that may require antibiotic treatment.
  • Support food sources that minimize excessive antibiotic use in animal feed.
  • Fighting antibiotic resistance requires funding for international research and improved infection control measures.
"Fighting antibiotic resistance requires funding international programmes and research projects for improved infection control, antibiotic management, and the creation of novel therapies."

In conclusion, responsible antibiotic use and preventive health measures are essential to combating antibiotic resistance, which poses a significant threat to public health.
newTitle: Essential Steps to Combat Antibiotic Resistance

title: Homemade Ginger Cough Drops In 10 Mins - You Just Need 2 Ingredients - NDTV Food
summary:
Homemade Ginger Cough Drops In 10 Mins - You Just Need 2 Ingredients

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Food

When the winter chill sets in and coughs and sore throats become an unwelcome companion, we often turn to store-bought remedies. But what if you could whip up a natural, chemical-free alternative right at home in just 10 minutes? Chef Neha Deepak Shah recently shared a simple recipe for homemade ginger cough drops on Instagram, and it's a game-changer.

Key Points:

  • Ingredients: 1 cup jaggery, 1/4 cup ginger juice.
  • Jaggery soothes throat irritation while ginger juice combats inflammation.
  • Cooking involves combining ingredients, heating, and testing for consistency.
  • Cough drops can be stored in an airtight container for weeks.
Chef Neha's special tip: Always use silicone or metal moulds to set the cough drops, as they withstand high heat.

These ginger cough drops are a healthier alternative to store-bought options, being free from processed sugar and preservatives.
newTitle: Homemade Ginger Cough Drops In 10 Minutes - A Simple Recipe

title: Blood sugar control is possible with diet, novel drugs and tech: What are takeaways from 2024? - The Indian Express
summary:
Blood sugar control is possible with diet, novel drugs and tech: What are takeaways from 2024?

Date: 2024

Source: Not specified

This year has witnessed transformative advancements in diabetes management, focusing on dietary habits and innovative technologies for better blood sugar control.

  • Advancements in wearable devices allow real-time glucose monitoring.
  • Research on traditional diets shows potential benefits in managing diabetes risks.
  • New drug therapies aim to enhance insulin sensitivity.
  • Genetic studies may lead to personalized treatment plans for diabetes patients.
  • Mental health support is increasingly recognized for young Type 1 diabetes patients.
  • Urban lifestyle factors contribute to Type 2 diabetes prevalence, especially in India.
  • Innovations like closed-loop systems and smart insulin pumps are revolutionizing management of diabetes.
“Urbanization, sedentary habits, air pollution, stress, and unhealthy diets are key triggers for Type 2 diabetes spiralling in India.”

Overall, 2024 signifies a pivotal year for diabetes management, combining dietary wisdom with modern technology to improve patient outcomes.

title: Long-Term Exposure to Air Pollution Linked to Blood Clots - Cancer Health Treatment News
summary:
Long-Term Exposure to Air Pollution Linked to Blood Clots

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: National Institutes of Health

Air pollution has long been associated with inflammation and various diseases. A recent study reveals a significant link between long-term air pollution exposure and increased risks for blood clots.

  • A study involving 6,651 U.S. adults over 17 years uncovered a correlation between air pollution and venous thromboembolism (VTE).
  • Approximately 3.7% of participants developed blood clots requiring hospital care.
  • Increased exposure to specific air pollutants was linked to a risk increase of 39% to over 200% for developing VTE.
  • VTE can have serious consequences, including complications and death.
“The likelihood of this outcome was linked to a risk increase based on long-term exposure to three different types of air pollutants.”

This study highlights the importance of air quality and its implications for cardiovascular health.
newTitle: Long-Term Exposure to Air Pollution Linked to Blood Clots

7 yoga asanas to control high uric acid levels - DNA India
summary:
7 Yoga Asanas to Control High Uric Acid Levels

Date: Dec 25, 2024

Source: DNA

High levels of uric acid can impact general health by causing diabetes and joint pain. Yoga is a useful tool for managing it. Here are 7 asanas to reduce uric acid and promote better well-being.

  • Ardha Matsyendrasana - Improves blood circulation and stimulates the kidneys.
  • Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose) - Enhances blood circulation and promotes kidney function.
  • Dhanurasana (Bow Pose) - Detoxifies and lowers uric acid while increasing digestion.
  • Pavanmuktasana (Wind-Relieving Pose) - Promotes improved kidney function and reduces gas.
  • Savasana (Death Pose) - Supports relaxation and reduces inflammation.
  • Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) - Boosts kidneys and improves detoxification.
  • Halasana (Plow Pose) - Aids in the removal of toxins and lowers uric acid levels.
This information is not DNA's opinion but obtained from media reports.

Incorporating these yoga asanas into regular practice can be a helpful approach in managing high uric acid levels.
newTitle: 7 Yoga Asanas to Control High Uric Acid Levels

title: Scientists develop scan that unravels secrets of lung function - Gujarat Samachar
summary:
Scientists Develop Scan that Unravels Secrets of Lung Function

Date: [Publication Date Not Provided] Source: Gujarat Samachar Digital

A team of scientists has developed a new method of scanning lungs that reveals the effects of treatment on lung function in real time, particularly for lung transplants.

  • The scan allows visualization of air movement in and out of the lungs for various lung conditions.
  • Researchers from Newcastle University demonstrated the scan's effectiveness in patients with asthma, COPD, and post-lung transplant.
  • Professor Andrew Fisher emphasized the scan's potential to detect issues in transplanted lungs earlier than traditional tests.
  • The method utilizes a special gas, perfluoropropane, that is detectable in MRI scans.
  • This could improve clinical trials and management of lung diseases.
“Our scans show where there is patchy ventilation in patients with lung disease...” - Professor Pete Thelwall

The advancement in scanning technology presents a promising future for lung disease management and emphasizes the importance of early intervention.
newTitle: New Lung Scan Technique Revealed by Scientists

title: Brain map clarifies neuronal connectivity behind motor function: Study - Hindustan Times
summary:
Brain Map Clarifies Neuronal Connectivity Behind Motor Function

Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: ANI

This study sheds light on the nervous system's physical layout and how the brain communicates with the spinal cord, enhancing our understanding of motor function.

Key Points:

  • Muscle movement occurs through brain signals sent to motor neurons, often via spinal interneurons.
  • Researchers at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital created a whole-brain atlas to illustrate direct brain inputs to V1 interneurons, essential for movement.
  • The atlas provides a basis for deeper insights into neural communication and the nervous system's organization.
  • Inhibiting a modified rabies virus helped trace neuronal circuits linking the brain to the spinal cord.
  • The research emphasizes the importance of understanding how different brain regions influence motor neuron activity.
“Defining the cellular targets of descending motor systems is fundamental to understanding neural control of movement and behavior.” - Jay Bikoff, PhD

The findings from this study will serve as a valuable resource for future research in the field of neurobiology, ultimately improving our grasp on movement control.
newTitle: Brain Map Clarifies Neuronal Connectivity Behind Motor Function

title: Healthy Kidney Signs: 4 Expert-Backed Tips from a Nephrologist to Manage Chronic Kidney Disease - TheHealthSite
summary:
Healthy Kidney Signs: 4 Expert-Backed Tips from a Nephrologist to Manage Chronic Kidney Disease

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: The Health Site

Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) is a serious health issue affecting millions globally. The article provides four expert-backed tips for managing and maintaining kidney health effectively.

Key Points:

  • Manage Blood Pressure: Keep your blood pressure below 140/90 mm Hg through a low sodium diet, quitting smoking, moderating alcohol intake, and regular exercise.
  • Eat a Healthy Diet: Focus on fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and limit unhealthy fats and sugars.
  • Stay Active: Aim for at least 30 minutes of physical activity most days.
  • Manage Blood Sugar: Maintain healthy blood sugar levels if diabetic and consult your doctor before taking OTC medications that may harm kidneys.

Notable Quotes:

“By following these simple tips, you can improve your kidney health and overall quality of life.”

This article emphasizes the importance of proactive management of CKD to prevent progression and enhance quality of life.
newTitle: Expert Tips for Managing Chronic Kidney Disease

title: Health News Live December 25, 2024 : Is your daily cup of coffee a boon in disguise? Study says it can lower this risk - Hindustan Times
Is your daily cup of coffee a boon in disguise? Study says it can lower this risk - Hindustan Times
summary:
Is Your Daily Cup of Coffee a Boon in Disguise? Study Says It Can Lower Head and Neck Cancer Risk

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A recent study suggests that drinking more than four cups of coffee daily may lower the risk of head and neck cancer by at least 17%. The research was led by Yuan-Chin Amy Lee, PhD, from the University of Utah School of Medicine.

  • The study involved data from 9,548 head and neck cancer patients and 15,783 control subjects.
  • Heavy coffee drinkers had a 30% lower risk of oral cavity cancer and a 22% lower risk of throat cancer.
  • Even decaffeinated coffee drinkers observed a 25% lower risk of oral cavity cancer.
  • Tea drinkers also showed a 29% lower risk of hypopharyngeal cancer.
“While there has been prior research on coffee and tea consumption and reduced risk of cancer, this study highlighted their varying effects with different sub-sites of head and neck cancer.” – Yuan-Chin Amy Lee, PhD

This study opens a new understanding of the protective effects of coffee and tea against certain cancers, urging further research in this vital area.
newTitle: Is Your Daily Cup of Coffee a Boon in Disguise? Study Says It Can Lower Head and Neck Cancer Risk

Honey Singh’s battle with bipolar disorder: How to spot symptoms, get the right therapy and sleep well - The Indian Express
summary:
Honey Singh’s battle with bipolar disorder: How to spot symptoms, get the right therapy and sleep well

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Indian Express

Rapper Honey Singh recently opened up about his struggles with bipolar disorder, which impacted his music career. After a long journey, he was diagnosed with the condition that was often misattributed to mood swings.

  • Challenges in diagnosing bipolar disorder often lead to misconceptions about mood swings being caused by work pressure.
  • Symptoms include severe mood swings, impulsive behavior, and paranoid thoughts.
  • Genetic factors play a considerable role in the onset of bipolar disorder.
  • Effective treatment involves mood stabilizers, antipsychotics, and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT).
  • Peer support and monitoring apps have proven beneficial in managing the disorder.
“Alok reported a significant reduction in the frequency and intensity of mood swings after treatment.”

Recognizing the symptoms and seeking appropriate help can significantly improve the quality of life for those affected by bipolar disorder.
newTitle: Honey Singh Shares His Struggle with Bipolar Disorder
